intro: Astracantha darmikii, commonly known as the Darmikii thistle, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring silver-green, spiny leaves and purple-blue flower heads. Its flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Astracantha darmikii is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to harsh, arid environments.
